docTitle.titlePart:
X-Ray and Neutron Diffraction Studies on Amorphous
Transitionmetal — Boron Alloys (Fe-B, Co-B, Ni-B)

byline.docAuthor: P. Lamparter, E. Nold, G. Rainer-Harbach, E. Grallath, and S. Steeb

titlePage.byline: Max-Planck-Institut für Metallforschung , Institut für Werkstoffwissenschaften, Stuttgart Germany

front.div:
The atomic-scale structure of the amorphous metallic alloys FesoBjjo, Cogi-yBig.ö, and
Nisi. Bis.s was investigated by X-ray- and neutron-diffraction covering a wide range of the ratio
( /metai/ftxmm ) of the scattering factors of both components. The structure factors S(q ) show a
pronounced dependence on the ratio /meUi//boron* In the cases of a small ratio an additional
peak near ? —21.5 nm -1 appears in the structure factors from which a definite distance between
B-B atoms, which are separated by metal atoms, is deduced. The corresponding structure factors
show only weak oscillations in the range of the second and third maxima, which are followed by
increased amplitudes at larger g's.
By Fourier-transformation radial distribution curves were evaluated, from which the distances
between the metal-metal-, the metal-boron-, and the boron-boron-atoms and the coordination
numbers are extracted. From the splitted first maximum of the radial distribution function in
the cases of small ratio /met*i//boron a * so partial coordination numbers could be obtained. The
results suggest some kind of short range order between the metal and the boron atoms.
